00019 #pragma once
00020 #ifndef SOCKETENGINE_H

00024 #include "util/SocketServer.h"

00026 
00027 class SocketTextHandler;
00028 
00029 
00030 /**
00031    @brief SocketEngine design notes:
00032    
00033    The SocketEngine utilizes a simple message passing protocol over a socket to run
00034    an APT engine cleass in a separate process. The idea being that it is cleaner and
00035    easier to have GUI programs like GTC run APT programs in a separate engine rather 
00036    than try to run them via COM objects or managed from C# code.
00037 
00038    The GUI programs traditionally tie into the global Verbose object's reporting
00039    system. For time reasons we didn't want to rewrite all of that code so the SocketEngine
00040    will handle running the other process remotely and translate the messages that 
00041    come over the socket to the local Verbose object. This way all of the existing
00042    code that ties into the local Verbose object will work unchanged.
00043 
00044    There are two phases to the socket engine. The first is the connection of 
00045    the foriegn process to the local SocketServer ojbect.
00046    
00047    @image html SocketCommunicationConnect.png "Phase 1: Delegate process connects to the SocketServer in supervisor process."
00048 
00049    The second phase is when the delegate process passes messages back from the
00050    delegate process Verbose calls to the supervising process and they are
00051    translated to calls in the local Verbose object.
00052 
00053    @image html SocketCommunicationMsg.png "Phase 2: Delegate process passes messages to the supervisor process which fires the usual calls in Verbose."
00054 
00055  */
00056 class SocketEngine {
00057 
00058 public:
00059 
00060     SocketEngine(const std::string &program, const std::string &jobFile, 
00061                  const std::string &host="127.0.0.1", unsigned int port=7889);
00062 
00063     SocketEngine(const std::string &program, const std::vector<std::string> &args, 
00064                  const std::string &host="127.0.0.1", unsigned int port=7889);
00065 
00066     ~SocketEngine();
00067 
00068         SocketServer server;
00069         
00070 
00071 #ifdef WIN32
00072         PROCESS_INFORMATION* getProcessInformation() {return &m_ProcInfo;}
00073         STARTUPINFO* getStartupInfo() {return &m_StartInfo;}
00074 
00075     void setApplicationName(LPTSTR lpApplicationName) {
00076         m_lpApplicationName = lpApplicationName;
00077     }
00078     void setProcessAttributes(LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES lpProcessAttributes) {
00079         m_lpProcessAttributes = lpProcessAttributes;
00080     }
00081     void setThreadAttributes(LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES lpThreadAttributes) {
00082         m_lpThreadAttributes = lpThreadAttributes;
00083     }
00084     void setInheritHandles(BOOL bInheritHandles) {
00085         m_bInheritHandles = bInheritHandles;
00086     }
00087     void setCreationFlags(DWORD dwCreationFlags) {
00088         m_dwCreationFlags = dwCreationFlags;
00089     }
00090     void setEnvironment(LPVOID lpEnvironment) {
00091         m_lpEnvironment = lpEnvironment;
00092     }
00093     void setCurrentDir(LPTSTR lpCurrentDirectory) {
00094         m_lpCurrentDirectory = lpCurrentDirectory;
00095     }
00096 #endif
00097 
00098     bool run();
00099         void TerminateLaunchedApp();    
00100     
00101 private:
00102     int doWindows(SocketServer &server, SocketTextHandler &handler, std::string &host, std::string &port,
00103                   std::vector<std::string> commandArgs);
00104     
00105     int doUnix(SocketServer &server, SocketTextHandler &handler, std::string &host, std::string &port,
00106                std::vector<std::string> commandArgs);
00107     
00108     std::string m_Program;
00109     std::vector<std::string> m_PgOpts;
00110     std::string m_Host;
00111     unsigned int m_Port;
00112     
00113 #ifdef WIN32
00114     PROCESS_INFORMATION m_ProcInfo;
00115     STARTUPINFO m_StartInfo;
00116     LPTSTR m_lpApplicationName;
00117 
00118     LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES m_lpProcessAttributes;
00119     LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES m_lpThreadAttributes;
00120     BOOL m_bInheritHandles;
00121     DWORD m_dwCreationFlags;
00122     LPVOID m_lpEnvironment;
00123     LPTSTR m_lpCurrentDirectory;
00124         TCHAR *ws;
00125     
00126     void initVars();      
00127 #else
00128     void initVars() {}; // no-op on windows
00129 #endif /* WIN32 */
00130 };
